title: CVPR_2008_258_abs

sentences.text: We propose a novel step toward the unsupervised seg-mentation of whole objects by combining '' hints '' of partial scene segmentation offered by multiple soft , binary mattes .
These mattes are implied by a set of hypothesized object boundary fragments in the scene .
Rather than trying to find or define a single '' best '' segmentation , we generate multiple segmentations of an image .

This reflects contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images , and it allows us to define intuitive evaluation met-rics for our sets of segmentations based on the accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects .
Our proposed approach builds on recent advances in spectral clustering , image matting , and boundary detection .
It is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively on a dataset of scenes and is suitable for current work in unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge .

summary: We propose a novel step toward the unsupervised seg-mentation of whole objects by combining '' hints '' of partial scene segmentation offered by multiple soft , binary mattes . These mattes are implied by a set of hypothesized object boundary fragments in the scene . Rather than trying to find or define a single '' best '' segmentation , we generate multiple segmentations of an image . This reflects contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images , and it allows us to define intuitive evaluation met-rics for our sets of segmentations based on the accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects . Our proposed approach builds on recent advances in spectral clustering , image matting , and boundary detection . It is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively on a dataset of scenes and is suitable for current work in unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge .

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To propose means to suggest or put forward an idea, plan, or solution for consideration and potential implementation. The predicate 'propose' connects the subject (the entity making the proposal) with the object (the proposed concept, action, or course of action), indicating that the subject is advocating for or recommending the object as a viable option.

Predicate-are_implied_by.label: are implied by
Predicate-are_implied_by.description: The predicate 'are implied by' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g. mattes) has its meaning or significance derived from, or logically connected to, the object (e.g. set of hypothesized object boundary fragments). In this sense, the subject's characteristics are inferred or suggested through their association with the object.

Predicate-reflects.label: reflects
Predicate-reflects.description: The predicate 'reflects' indicates a relationship where the subject represents or embodies the characteristics, principles, or ideas described by the object. In general, it suggests that the subject has incorporated or internalized the qualities or concepts expressed by the object.

Predicate-builds_on.label: builds on
Predicate-builds_on.description: Indicates that the subject relies upon or draws inspiration from the object to create a foundation for its own existence, development, or understanding. The predicate 'builds on' suggests a relationship of dependence, where the subject leverages the ideas, concepts, or principles presented in the object as a starting point or basis for further exploration.

Predicate-is_demonstrated_qualitatively_.label: is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively on a dataset of scenes
Predicate-is_demonstrated_qualitatively_.description: This predicate indicates that the subject's properties or characteristics are showcased through a comprehensive representation provided by the object - a dataset of scenes. The combination of qualitative and quantitative aspects highlights both the inherent nature (qualitative) and measurable patterns (quantitative) present within these scenes, effectively demonstrating the subject's attributes.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general concept or category represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject is a particular case or exemplar within the scope defined by the object.
